name: BIPARTISANAL
description: Ok, so I made up a word, sue me. There isn't a real word BIPARTISANAL, but there is bipartisan (adjective) and bipartisanship (adjective). I feel that this word could be a real word because it describes something that both parties are doing in a bipartisan way. Sort of an over descriptor, but valid none-the-less. I mean it'll never be accepted as a real word, but it's fun to come up with new words from time-to-time. In BIPARTISANAL, the work, we see that we can separate words within the main word almost exactly along syllabic sounds: BI-PART-IS-ANAL. Technically the ANAL, should read AN-AL, but that wouldn't make for good art now would it? For those that are sticklers for form/function/spelling/grammar/blah blah blah...sometimes you gotta break the rules. Just remember what Willy Wonka said, "We are the music makers and we are the dreamers of dreams." But I digress...So when we read out the words we see a pattern, the words read forward and then in reverse. Bipartisanship is hard work. It's difficult to get anything done when the other side just wants to be a stick in the mud towards real progress. You can read into the sexual innuendos if you'd like, I think it's pretty obvious and doesn't need too much guidance on that avenue.
